definitions.definition: A light, porous type of pyroclastic igneous rock, formed during explosive volcanic eruptions when liquid lava is ejected into water or air as a froth containing masses of gas bubbles. As the lava solidifies, the bubbles are frozen into the rock.
To abrade or roughen with pumice.
Physical, sexual or emotional mistreatment of a child that causes long-term or permanent damage.
To shrivel, droop or dry up, especially from lack of water.
To cause to shrivel or dry up.
To lose vigour or power; to languish; to pass away.
To become helpless due to emotion.
To make helpless due to emotion.
To go against, resist; oppose.
The part of the back of a four-legged animal that is between the shoulder blades; in many species the highest point of the body and the standard place to measure the animal's height.
A lake or long, narrow inlet, especially in Ireland.
Finally resulting or occuring (after a period of time).
Pertaining to events; event-related, evential.
(NNSE or European Union) Possible, potential.
definitions.example: They both opposed an eventual imposition of anti-dumping measures as they considered that it could lead to a cessation of imports of the product concerned from the PRC79.

definitions.definition: Any of a group of various types of grass or its grains used as food, widely cultivated in the developing world.
A semi-autonomous confessional community under the Ottoman Empire, especially a non-Muslim one.
Exceeding the bounds of something; roving; hence, foreign.
Extreme; wild; excessive; unrestrained.
definitions.example: extravagant acts, praise, or abuse

definitions.definition: Exorbitant.
Profuse in expenditure; prodigal; wasteful.
definitions.example: an extravagant man;  extravagant expense

definitions.definition: Any food that is considered to be especially beneficial to health.
A facial expression in which the eyebrows are brought together, and the forehead is wrinkled, usually indicating displeasure, sadness or worry, or less often confusion or concentration.
A facial expression in which the corners of the mouth are pointed down.
To have a frown on one's face.
definitions.example: She frowned when I told her the news.

definitions.definition: To manifest displeasure or disapprobation; to look with disfavour or threateningly.
definitions.example: Noisy gossip in the library is frowned upon.

definitions.definition: To repress or repel by expressing displeasure or disapproval; to rebuke with a look.
definitions.example: Let us frown the impudent fellow into silence.

definitions.definition: To communicate by frowning.
definitions.example: Frank frowned his displeasure with my proposal.

definitions.definition: The branch of lexicology devoted to the study of names and naming, especially the origins of names.
(proper) The racemic freebase of 1-phenylpropan-2-amine; an equal parts mixture of levoamphetamine and dextroamphetamine in their pure amine forms.
Any mixture of the two amphetamine enantiomers, dextroamphetamine and levoamphetamine.
Referring to a substituted amphetamine; a member of the amphetamine class of chemicals.
A potent central nervous system stimulant of the phenethylamine chemical class that is used to treat ADHD, narcolepsy, and obesity.
The young of a swan.
The belief that a society or system should be run by an elite.
The superior attitude or behaviour associated with an elite.
An unidentified flying object; UFO; usually with disc-like properties.
definitions.example: Some connect the recent spate of flying saucer sightings with a rumored top-secret military aviation project.

definitions.definition: An alien interplanetary vessel with a disc-like shape and generally metallic appearance.
A form of confectionery, a small spheroidal capsule of rice paper filled with sherbet.
A plate used to serve the side dish.
The side dish itself.
The act of repelling or the condition of being repelled.
An extreme dislike of something, or hostility to something.
The repulsive force acting between bodies of the same electric charge or magnetic polarity.
Not speaking; not knowing what to say; silent, especially due to surprise, amazement, etc.
definitions.example: When he walked into his surprise birthday party, he was completely speechless.

definitions.definition: Incapable of being spoken or uttered
Unfit or not permitted to be spoken or described.
Extremely bad or objectionable.
definitions.example: an unspeakable fool

definitions.definition: Soldiers considered as a group.
The profession or skill of being a soldier.
To lock up; to lock in a safe place, out of view.
Not prejudiced.
To alert or inform someone, especially confidentially.
definitions.example: An anonymous caller tipped off the police that the suspect would be in the area.

definitions.definition: To put the ball in play by throwing it up between two opponents.
To pour out (liquor); to tip the vessel and drink until it is empty.
To use a particular brush technique for producing a flawless surface on a wet coat of paint.
A cocktail containing rum, pineapple juice, coconut milk and a dash of syrup, blended with crushed ice.
Work to be done, obligation.
Unpaid debt.
That which is in the rear or behind.
A shopping center.
Any of the rodents of the family Sciuridae distinguished by their large bushy tail.
A person, usually a freezoner, who applies L. Ron Hubbard's technology in a heterodox manner.
One of the small rollers of a carding machine which work with the large cylinder.
To store in a secretive manner, to hide something for future use
In a manner which leaves little question; definitely, clearly.
definitions.example: In a decidedly petulant manner she sat with crossed arms and a frown.

definitions.definition: In a decided or final manner; resolutely.
Paint applied in the form of a spray, especially from an aerosol can.
To apply paint in the form of a spray, especially from an aerosol can.
A room in a hospital used for performing surgery (originally designed for operations in front of observers).
To hit or strike violently and repeatedly.
definitions.example: The firemen battered down the door.

definitions.definition: To coat with batter (the food ingredient).
definitions.example: I prefer it when they batter the cod with breadcrumbs.

definitions.definition: To defeat soundly; to thrash.
definitions.example: Leeds United battered Charlton 7-0.

definitions.definition: (usually in the passive) To intoxicate.
definitions.example: I was battered last night on our pub crawl.

definitions.definition: To flatten (metal) by hammering, so as to compress it inwardly and spread it outwardly.
To slope (of walls, buildings etc.).
Beaten up through a lot of use; in rough condition; weathered.
Beaten repeatedly or consistently; beaten up.
Coated with batter.
A preparation that removes hair from the body.
That removes hair
To bring peace to (a place or situation), by ending war, fighting, violence, anger or agitation.
To appease (someone).
One who performs gymnastics
Defamatory, libeling, referring to something that causes harm to someone's reputation especially with malice or disregard.
definitions.example: The accusation was libelous, full of falsehoods, spite and malice.

definitions.definition: Meeting the legal standards for libel.
definitions.example: The court found the statement was not libelous because it was true.

definitions.definition: Any of several kinds of common insects green in color:
definitions.example: These bats prey on greenfly.

definitions.definition: A wide receiver.
Kentucky bluegrass, Poa pratensis.

A style of country music with roots in Scots-Irish Appalachian folk music, blues, and jazz and characterized by banjos, fiddles, acoustic guitars, dobros, and mandolins; but containing no drums, electric guitars, pianos or other keyboard or wind instruments.
Overly proud of oneself, especially concerning appearance; having a high opinion of one's own accomplishments with slight reason.
Having no real substance, value, or importance; empty; void; worthless; unsatisfying.
Effecting no purpose; pointless, futile.
definitions.example: vain toil;  a vain attempt

definitions.definition: Showy; ostentatious.
Use of acerbic language to mock or convey contempt, often using irony and (in speech) often marked by overemphasis and a sneering tone of voice.
definitions.example: Sarcasm is the lowest form of wit.

definitions.definition: An act of sarcasm.
An enclosed resort providing accommodation (often in chalets) and entertainment, generally aimed at families.
A male child whose baptism is sponsored by a godparent.
An act of blushing; a red glow on the face caused by shame, modesty, etc.
A glow; a flush of colour, especially pink or red.
Feeling or appearance of optimism.
A sort of makeup, frequently a powder, used to redden the cheeks.
A color between pink and cream.
A pale pink wine made by removing the dark grape skins at the required point during fermentation.
To become red in the face (and sometimes experience an associated feeling of warmth), especially due to shyness, shame, excitement, or embarrassment.
definitions.example: He wasn't used to this much attention, so he blushed as he saw dozens of pairs of eyes watching him.

definitions.definition: To be ashamed or embarrassed (to do something).
To become red.
To suffuse with a blush; to redden; to make rosy.
To change skin color in the face (to a particular shade).
definitions.example: I wasn't surprised, but it was embarrassing enough that I blushed a little pink.

definitions.definition: To express or make known by blushing.
definitions.example: Looking at me with a knowing glare, she blushed her discomfort with the situation.

definitions.definition: To have a warm and delicate colour, like some roses and other flowers.
definitions.example: The garden was full of blossoms that blushed in myriad shades to form a beautiful carpet of color.

definitions.definition: To glance with the eye, cast a glance.
The collective noun for a group of boys.
definitions.example: A blush of boys.

definitions.definition: A shade of the color white.
Pure, unblemished, immaculate.
definitions.example: Not a pimple nor freckle marred her lily-white skin

definitions.definition: Innocent, having a reputation beyond reproach.
(sometimes derogatory) Caucasian; white.
A person who emigrates from one region to another to seek an improvement in living standards.
A rush or hurry, especially making use of the limbs against a surface.
definitions.example: a last-minute scramble to the finish line

definitions.definition: An emergency defensive air force mission to intercept attacking enemy aircraft.
A motocross race.
Any frantic period of competitive activity.
To move hurriedly to a location, especially by using all limbs against a surface.
To proceed to a location or an objective in a disorderly manner.
(of food ingredients, usually including egg) To thoroughly combine and cook as a loose mass.
definitions.example: I scrambled some eggs with spinach and cheese.

definitions.definition: To process (telecommunication signals) to make them unintelligible to an unauthorized listener.
To quickly deploy (vehicles, usually aircraft) to a destination in response to an alert, usually to intercept an attacking enemy.
To be quickly deployed in this manner.
To partake in motocross.
To ascend rocky terrain as a leisure activity.
To gather or collect by scrambling.
definitions.example: to scramble up wealth

definitions.definition: To struggle eagerly with others for something thrown upon the ground; to go down upon all fours to seize something; to catch rudely at what is desired.
To throw something down for others to compete for in this manner.
Shouted when something desirable is thrown into a group of people who individually want that item, causing them to rush for it.
Someone who devises or suggests a project; a proposer or planner of something.
An optical device that projects a beam of light, especially one used to project an image (or moving images) onto a screen.
One who projects, or ascribes his/her own feelings to others.
An operator that forms a projection.
A character in a role-playing game or computer game whose actions are not controlled by a player.
Any of various kinds of food that have been immersed in a substance for both flavor and preservation.
To prepare (food) in this manner.
Drool; saliva.
A weak, unsteady stream; a trickle.
A small amount of a liquid.
In sport(s), the act of moving (with) a ball by kicking or bouncing it.
(basketball, soccer) In various ball games, to move (with) the ball, controlling its path by kicking or bouncing it repeatedly
To let saliva drip from the mouth, to drool
To fall in drops or an unsteady stream, to trickle
To let something fall in drips.
To live or pass one's time in a trivial fashion.
A plot within a story, subsidiary to the main plot.
A subdivision of a plot of land, especially one used for an agricultural experiment.
To provide (a story) with a subplot.
Agent noun of blush; one who blushes.
Face makeup that makes the cheeks rosier.
Any of several closely related, edible species of the genus Amanita, including Amanita rubescens and Amanita novinupta.
Food that is served quickly, often standardized and pre-prepared.
A type of food that is quickly made, but of low nutritional value; junk food.
Anything standardized, quickly available, and inexpensive, often, of low value.
A person who makes, repairs, or alters clothes professionally, especially suits and men's clothing.
definitions.example: He works as a tailor on Swanston Street.

definitions.definition: The bluefish (Pomatomus saltatrix).
To make, repair, or alter clothes.
definitions.example: We can tailor that jacket for you if you like.

definitions.definition: To make or adapt (something) for a specific need.
definitions.example: The website was tailored to the client's needs.

definitions.definition: To restrict (something) in order to meet a particular need.
definitions.example: a narrowly tailored law

definitions.definition: A kind of cheese with bluish mold in it.
Not valid; not true, correct, acceptable or appropriate.
definitions.example: This invalid contract cannot be legally enforced.

definitions.definition: (sometimes offensive) Any person with a disability or illness.
(sometimes offensive) A person who is confined to home or bed because of illness, disability or injury; one who is too sick or weak to care for themselves.
A disabled member of the armed forces; one unfit for active duty due to injury.
To exempt from duty because of injury or ill health.
definitions.example: He was invalided home after the car crash.

definitions.definition: To make invalid or affect with disease.
Intended for use by an invalid.
A person whose job is making, repairing or selling jewelry.
Excessively ambitious
A room in a building that houses the boiler(s) and similar equipment.
A compartment on a steamship that houses the boiler.
A telemarketing firm that makes cold calls.
Any device that activates or deactivates the components of a machine or system according to a preplanned sequence (as in a washing machine, or central heating system).
A device or system that orders and/or modifies digitally stored music and sound for playback.
definitions.example: a MIDI sequencer

definitions.definition: A device for determining the sequence of monomers in a polymer, especially amino acids in protein, or bases in DNA; A sequenator.
A control device to increase/decrease the capacity of plant that is enabled to act in a specific order or sequence.
To reduce the book value of (an asset) to zero.
To record (an expenditure) as an expense.
To remove a portion of a debt or an amount of an account owed, counting it as a loss (as a gesture of goodwill for example).
To record a notional expense such as amortization or depreciation.
To treat as a write-off, a total loss, especially something damaged beyond economic repair.
To assign a low value to (something).
definitions.example: When Katya was injured, he wrote off the team's chances in the finals.

definitions.definition: The cancellation of an item; the amount cancelled or lost
Something that is now worthless (such as a car after an accident)
A flash of light produced by short-duration, high-voltage discharge of electricity within a cloud, between clouds, or between a cloud and the earth.
definitions.example: Although we did not see the lightning, we did hear the thunder.

definitions.definition: A discharge of this kind.
definitions.example: That tree was hit by lightning.

definitions.definition: Anything that moves very fast.
The act of making bright, or the state of being made bright; enlightenment; brightening, as of the mental powers.
To produce lightning.
Extremely fast or sudden; moving (as if) at the speed of lightning.
A relationship of mutual benefit, especially among different species.
A close, prolonged association between two or more organisms of different species, regardless of benefit to the members.
(possibly obsolete) The state of people living together in a community.
A group of individuals or companies formed to transact some specific business, or to promote a common interest; a self-coordinating group.
definitions.example: a gambling syndicate

definitions.definition: The office or jurisdiction of a syndic; a body or council of syndics.
To become a syndicate.
To put under the control of a group acting as a unit.
(mass media) To release media content through a syndicate to be broadcast or published through multiple outlets.
A low-lying area of grassland that is subject to seasonal flooding
A circular piece of paper, designed to be fixed to the inside of a windscreen, that serves as a record that a vehicle has been properly taxed (no longer used)
The state of a glowing object.
The condition of being passionate or having warm feelings.
The brilliance or warmth of color in an environment or on a person (especially one's face).
definitions.example: He had a bright red glow on his face.

definitions.definition: To give off light from heat or to emit light as if heated.
definitions.example: The fire was still glowing after ten hours.

definitions.definition: To radiate some emotional quality like light.
definitions.example: The zealots glowed with religious fervor.

definitions.definition: To gaze especially passionately at something.
To radiate thermal heat.
definitions.example: After their workout, the gymnasts' faces were glowing red.

definitions.definition: To shine brightly and steadily.
definitions.example: The new baby's room glows with bright, loving colors.

definitions.definition: To make hot; to flush.
To feel hot; to have a burning sensation, as of the skin, from friction, exercise, etc.; to burn.
Possessing tact; able to deal with people in a sensitive manner.
The land area surrounding a dock, especially the renovated or gentrified areas surrounding a former dock.
The state of being tired.
Of perishable items, overridden with bacteria and other infectious agents.
definitions.example: If you leave a bin unattended for a few weeks, the rubbish inside will turn rotten.

definitions.definition: In a state of decay.
definitions.example: His mouth stank and his teeth were rotten.

definitions.definition: Cruel, mean or immoral.
definitions.example: That man is a rotten father.

definitions.definition: Bad or terrible.
definitions.example: It was a rotten idea to take the boat out today.

definitions.definition: To an extreme degree.
definitions.example: That kid is spoilt rotten.

definitions.definition: A condition of existence without predictability or security, affecting material or psychological welfare.
Less than prime; inferior.
(now worldwide) Designating a loan (typically at a greater than usual rate of interest) offered to a borrower who is not qualified for other loans (for example, because of a poor credit history).
Designating a type of commercial lending rate, less than the prime rate, offered to desirable borrowers.
(law enforcement) Anti-Social Behaviour Order
One who has been issued with the above legal order.
Not permissible; not to be permitted or allowed
Suffering from aches, sore.
Having a sound, strong body; physically competent; robust; fit for service.
Capable of performing all requisite duties as a seaman, specifically in the Royal Navy, a rating between leading and ordinary.
A cosmetic used to darken and thicken the eyelashes.
To apply mascara to the eyelashes
A word or other feature originating in the English language that has been borrowed by another language.
A Briticism.
A cultural aspect typical of the English people.
A moderate, but uncomfortable and penetrating coldness.
definitions.example: There was a chill in the air.

definitions.definition: A sudden penetrating sense of cold, especially one that causes a brief trembling nerve response through the body; the trembling response itself; often associated with illness: fevers and chills, or susceptibility to illness.
definitions.example: Close the window or you'll catch a chill.   I felt a chill when the wind picked up.

definitions.definition: An uncomfortable and numbing sense of fear, dread, anxiety, or alarm, often one that is sudden and usually accompanied by a trembling nerve response resembling the body's response to biting cold.
definitions.example: Despite the heat, he felt a chill as he entered the crime scene.   The actor's eerie portrayal sent chills through the audience.   His menacing presence cast a chill over everyone.

definitions.definition: An iron mould or portion of a mould, serving to cool rapidly, and so to harden, the surface of molten iron brought in contact with it.
The hardened part of a casting, such as the tread of a carriage wheel.
A lack of warmth and cordiality; unfriendliness.
Calmness; equanimity.
A sense of style; trendiness; savoir faire.
To lower the temperature of something; to cool
definitions.example: Chill before serving.

definitions.definition: To become cold
definitions.example: In the wind he chilled quickly.

definitions.definition: To harden a metal surface by sudden cooling
To become hard by rapid cooling
To relax, lie back
definitions.example: Chill, man, we've got a whole week to do it; no sense in getting worked up.

definitions.definition: To "hang", hang out; to spend time with another person or group. Also chill out.
definitions.example: Hey, we should chill this weekend.

definitions.definition: To smoke marijuana
definitions.example: On Friday night do you wanna chill?

definitions.definition: To discourage, depress
definitions.example: Censorship chills public discourse.

definitions.definition: Moderately cold or chilly.
definitions.example: A chill wind was blowing down the street.

definitions.definition: Unwelcoming; not cordial.
definitions.example: Arriving late at the wedding, we were met with a chill reception.

definitions.definition: Calm, relaxed, easygoing.
definitions.example: Paint-your-own ceramics studios are a chill way to express yourself while learning more about your date's right brain.

definitions.definition: "Cool"; meeting a certain hip standard or garnering the approval of a certain peer group.
definitions.example: That new movie was chill, man.

definitions.definition: Okay, not a problem.
definitions.example: "Sorry about that." "It's chill."

definitions.definition: A soldier of private rank in cavalry or armour.
A cavalry horse; charger.
A soldier.
A troopship.
A state trooper.
A mounted policeman.
One who endures adversity or hardship with an attitude of stoicism and persistence.
definitions.example: He was a real trooper about taking care of the kids for the weekend.

definitions.definition: To work as a trooper.
To work steadily at an unpleasant job without complaint.
